question: How many times in a day, are the hands of a clock in straight line but opposite in direction?
explanation:
The hands of a clock point in opposite directions (in the same straight line) 11 times in every 12 hours. (Because between 5 and 7 they point in opposite directions at 6 o'clcok only).
So, in a day, the hands point in the opposite directions 22 times.

question: How many times do the hands of a clock coincide in a day?
explanation:
The hands of a clock coincide 11 times in every 12 hours (Since between 11 and 1, they coincide only once, i.e., at 12 o'clock).

question: A watch which gains uniformly is 2 minutes low at noon on Monday and is 4 min. 48 sec fast at 2 p.m. on the following Monday. When was it correct?
answers: [{"option_value": "2 p.m. on Tuesday", "optionl2_value": "", "has_file": 0, "file_name": ""},{"option_value": "2 p.m. on Wednesday", "optionl2_value": "", "has_file": 0, "file_name": ""},{"option_value": "3 p.m. on Thursday", "optionl2_value": "", "has_file": 0, "file_name": ""},{"option_value": "1 p.m. on Friday", "optionl2_value": "", "has_file": 0, "file_name": ""}]
explanation:
Time from 12 p.m. on Monday to 2 p.m. on the following Monday = 7 days 2 hours = 170 hours.

∴ Watch is correct 2 days 2 hrs. after 12 p.m. on Monday i.e., it will be correct at 2 p.m. on Wednesday.
question_l2: A watch which gains uniformly is 2 minutes low at noon on Monday and is 4 min. 48 sec fast at 2 p.m. on the following Monday. When was it correct?
explanation_l2:

∴ Watch is correct 2 days 2 hrs. after 12 p.m. on Monday i.e., it will be correct at 2 p.m. on Wednesday.
